reviewText: Great series! Nova is well produced. Great assortment of topics. Great for kids to watch too- very educational.Don't pass it by.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: This review is on the episode, "The Bible's Buried Secrets."  It's description is:  "A powerful partnership between science and scholarship breaks exciting new ground in investigating the origins of the ancient Israelites, their faith in a single, omnipotent God and the creation of the Bible."  This is terrible scholarship.  It seeks to gain what the Israelites were "really like," but ignores or accepts as false the things the Israelites recorded about themselves in the Old Testament.  That's like looking at our Constitution and Bill of Rights, then saying, "But the early Americans were really against the right to bear arms, against freedom of the press, and against freedom of religion."  For instance, they note that archeology has uncovered in Israel the idols of multiple gods; then they attribute those to the "early Israelites"!  The Old Testament records that the peoples in the land before the Israelites had many gods and many idols.  Why ignore a primary text?
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: Just a taste as far as I am concerned due to having so much background ,but a real keeper for those not familiar with NSA.  Takes more of the mystery out of the Agency.  It makes you want more if your inclined to this field of spying.  Should be popular now that the Agency is getting some publicity.  It is amazing how many years of operation that they kept the lid on until Snowden.  I would recommend this asset.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: 40 minutes of information crammed into 50 minutes of programming.  Less contrived drama and more hard facts would appeal to me.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: NOVA has been great for decades and I don't see this changing any time soon!  So much variety and wonderful in-depth information to be had.
summary: How could you ever go wrong?
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: This NOVA show featured a once-in-40-year rat population explosion that eats all the farmers' rice crop. So every 40 years there is potential famine and social upheaval. Scientists discovered the reason - the once-in-40-year blooming of a bamboo plant. This specie of bamboo produces giant seeds that have plenty of food in them for the rats. The black rats have a unique ability to multiply quickly if there's a food source.The amazing thing about this bamboo is the ability to accurately time production of these seeds. It does so this way to make sure there will be too many seeds for animals to eat and some will produce the next generation of bamboo.I loved this show because it demonstrates how nature is the big determinant in our lives, at least some times. At the same time, I felt sorry for the villagers that have a difficult time with food production when this event occurs.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: This was always great presentations.  I like watching most things they offer.  Very educational and always interesting to go behind the scenes.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: The amount of information that comes from this program is astounding, learning about how strong the partnership is between scientists and archieologists on their own thoughts and discoveries of new and exciting paths with investigating the origins of the ancient Israelites, their faith which was originally open and included idols, plus becoming a single path to praying to only one God and the stories at creation of the Bible with many hands.  A lot of information, very long program, so maybe not for the younger generation.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: I have been watching Nova Series, ever since it began in the 70"s.  Every episode explores some aspect of the world of science.  The episodes are always presented in a simple and interesting context.  The subject matter includes a full-spectrum of  interesting topics.  There will always be room in my TV life for episodes of  Nova.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: Good quality video and sound. Awesome content in all the nova programs! Great to watch with my kids as I did with my family growing up.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: NASA has the largest collection of linguists, mathematicians, and computer experts in America at its Northern Virginia headquarters. NOVA documents how it has transitioned from tracking the Soviet Union (a large entity with a known location) to terrorists (numerous unknown small groups, at unknown locations), and in the process also reports evidence indicating an incredible failure to protect the nation pre-9/11, even though bin-Laden et al were being monitored from 1996, starting with his satellite phone and numerous calls to/from a house in Yemen's capital. Now technology has evolved and messages mostly travel on fiber-optic cables.The basic problem - NSA did not share information with the FBI. No useful warnings were sounded prior to the embassy bombings in Africa, the Cole bombing, or even 9/11. Their primary excuse - sharing such information was banned by law; however, they could have obtained a FISA warrant, making this legal. The 9/11 Commission did little investigation of the NSA's role and failure prior to 9/11.NSA has transitioned from monitoring too little to monitoring far too much, lacking good computer programs for zeroing in on the most important communications. This is made especially difficult by the fact that reference to eg. 'a milk bottle' may mean something entirely different.
summary: Good Documentation About Incredibly Poor Performance
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: I purchased this video because of my interest in the NSA as I have had with dozens of Federal agencies. The one point that struck me odd was the crash of the computers at NSA at the most critical point just prior to 9/11. The reason it was odd is because the head of the NSA at the time only said that it was a critical time for their computer system to crash, erasing all data to date and unable to track the movements of the terrorists just prior to the attack on the world trade center's two towers, attack on the pentagon and the crash of another hi-jacked plane in a deserted field. I would have been suspicious of the coincident. The timing was too coincidental. I would have suspected it was an inside job and dug further but nothing else was mentioned. Was the NSA in on the attacks? What do they know they aren't revealing and why is it the Bush administration now claims we must give up our personal privacy. Sorry, but I don't trust a government run by religions and corporations.
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: Produced for the Nova television series, "The Spy Factory" is a one hour documentary showcasing riveting true stories drawn from the American government's National Security Agency. Providing an exploration and explanation of this top secret agency's inner workings in terms of its technological capabilities, limitations and procedures, "The Spy Factory" addresses the pivotal question of our time: Are Americans safer today after the horrific attacks of 9/11? Revealed is the shocking disclosure that the NSA knew the identities of key 9/11 conspirators and have even tracked them on American soil for at last five years prior to the incident. All this an more presents sobering, informative, thoughtful and thought-provoking revelations of what the NSA is capable of accomplishing in terms of the effectiveness of high-tech surveillance in an age of terrorism -- and how the top echelons of the Bush administration failed us all. "The Spy Factory" is a highly recommended addition to community library DVD collections, and will prove to be of intense interest for non-specialist general viewers with an interest in national security issues.
summary: Riveting true stories drawn from the American government's National Security Agency
Title: The Spy Factory

reviewText: Having spent many hours in Engineering and archeology classes this was very interesting to me - if you do not like the history of South America or are a Religious savant that believes that the earth is 5,000 years old then you will have a hard time reconcilling the information provided with what you have been told by others.
summary: Pure information set in the usual high quality that NOVA provides
Title: The Spy Factory
